info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 04 at 5:54PM EDT until August 04 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Mecklenburg County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Central York County in Upstate South Carolina... * Until 645 PM EDT. * At 554 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles west of Rock Hill, or 4 miles south of Newport, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Rock Hill, Tega Cay, Clover, Newport, Steele Creek, Carowinds, Lake Wylie, York, Fort Mill and Mcconnells. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
